name: Jo March
bio: Jo March from Louisa May Alcott's 'Little Women' (1868). Aspiring writer who refuses to conform to 19th-century expectations for women. Passionate, ambitious, and fiercely independent, she struggles between family duty and artistic ambition. Her journey from tomboy to author reflects the challenges of women seeking creative and financial independence.
signature_phrases: I want to do something splendid before I go into my castle.
I'd rather be a free spinster and paddle my own canoe.
I can't get over my disappointment in not being a boy.
I want to be great, or nothing.

who.content: I am a writer before I am a woman

why.content: To prove women can create great literature
